scoring.ska_sdc.sdc2.utils package

Submodules

scoring.ska_sdc.sdc2.utils.create_score module

src.scoring.ska_sdc.sdc2.utils.create_score.compute_score_value(config, sdc_score, match_sub_df, n_det, n_rej)[source]

Compute the per-match accuracy and generate the final score report.

Parameters

  • config (configparser.ConfigParser) – SDC2 scorer config

  • sdc_score (ska_sdc.sdc2.models.sdc2_score.Sdc2Score) – The SDC2 score object to populate

  • match_sub_df (pandas.DataFrame) – The sieved matches that are below the multi_d threshold

  • n_det (int) – The total number of detected sources in the submission

  • n_rej (int) – Number of candidate matches rejected on the basis of multi_d

src.scoring.ska_sdc.sdc2.utils.create_score.create_sdc_score(config, sieved_sub_df, n_det, train, detail)[source]

Complete the scoring pipeline using the data generated by the previous steps. This requires the prepared truth and submission catalogues, and the candidate match catalogues created from the crossmatch step.

Parameters

  • sieved_sub_df (pandas.DataFrame) – The processed and sieved candidate match catalogue between submission and truth.

  • n_det (int) – Total number of detected sources.

  • train (bool) – Whether the score is determined based on training area only

  • detail (bool) – If True, will include the detailed score and match data with the returned Sdc2Score object.

scoring.ska_sdc.sdc2.utils.score_helper module

src.scoring.ska_sdc.sdc2.utils.score_helper.get_i_scores(i_acc_s, i_thr, max_score)[source]

Compute the inclination angle scores; calculate the score, weighted by the set i threshold value.

Parameters

i_acc_s (pd.Series) – i accuracy series.

src.scoring.ska_sdc.sdc2.utils.score_helper.get_pa_acc_series(pa_s, pa_t_s)[source]

Calculate position angle (PA) accuracy series based on measured and truth values, after correcting for angle degeneracies.

Parameters

  • pa_s (pd.Series) – Measured PA series.

  • pa_t_s (pd.Series) – True corresponding PA series.

src.scoring.ska_sdc.sdc2.utils.score_helper.get_pa_scores(pa_acc_s, pa_thr, max_score)[source]

Compute the position angle scores; calculate the score, weighted by the set pa threshold value.

Parameters

pa_acc_s (pd.Series) – Position angle accuracy series.

src.scoring.ska_sdc.sdc2.utils.score_helper.get_pos_acc_series(ra_s, dec_s, ra_t_s, dec_t_s, hi_size_t_s, beam_size)[source]

Calculate positional accuracy series based on passed measured and truth values.

Parameters

  • ra_s (pd.Series) – Measured RA series.

  • dec_s (pd.Series) – Measured Dec series.

  • ra_t_s (pd.Series) – True RA series.

  • dec_t_s (pd.Series) – True Dec series.

  • hi_size_t_s (pd.Series) – True HI size series, to estimate source size.

  • beam_size (float) – The primary beam size

src.scoring.ska_sdc.sdc2.utils.score_helper.get_position_scores(pos_acc_series, position_thr, max_score)[source]

Compute the position scores; calculate the score, weighted by the set position threshold value.

The maximum score per source is SCORE_MAX

Parameters

  • core_acc_series (pd.Series) – Positional accuracy (core) series.

  • cent_acc_series (pd.Series) – Positional accuracy (centroid) series.

scoring.ska_sdc.sdc2.utils.sdc2_xmatch module

class src.scoring.ska_sdc.sdc2.utils.sdc2_xmatch.Sdc2XMatch(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: KDTreeXMatch

Crossmatch sources for the SDC2 scoring use case.

crossmatch_kdtree()[source]

Explicit declaration of super class method.

get_all_col()[source]

Get the column names in truth and submitted catalogues which should be stored in the output candidate match dataframe.

In the SDC2 case, these are set as a class member.

get_kdtree()[source]

Get the point K-D tree object. This is constructed considering the positions and frequency of sources in the truth catalogue.

Returns

k-dimensional tree space partitioning data structure.

Return type

sklearn.neighbors.KDTree

get_query_coords()[source]

Get the submitted catalogue positions to query the KDTree.

The mode attribute tells the XMatch whether to use core or centroid positions.

Returns

The submitted catalogue coordinate pairs, used to query the KDTree.

Return type

numpy.array

get_radius_arr()[source]

Get the size array that sets the maximum distance a submitted source can lie from a truth source to be considered a candidate match.

In the SDC2 case this is stored as the largest_size in the submitted source catalogue.

scoring.ska_sdc.sdc2.utils.xmatch_preprocessing_steps module

class src.scoring.ska_sdc.sdc2.utils.xmatch_preprocessing_steps.ScaleAndCalculateLargestSize(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: XMatchPreprocessingStep

Calculate the additional properties that will be used in crossmatching.

execute()[source]

Calculate convolved size; this is necessary to control for the potentially small Gaussian source sizes, which could yield an unrepresentative positional accuracy.

Thus we calculate the apparent size by convolving with the beam size.

Returns

Processed catalogue.

Return type

pandas.DataFrame
